data.title: Person: Giorgos Karagounis
data.meta_description: Person: Giorgos Karagounis: A comprehensive series of articles on this topic
data.text:
Fulham manager Martin Jol made three changes to his side for the visit of Stoke in the Barclays Premier League.

Fulham striker Bryan Ruiz is rated as 50/50 as he battles against a hamstring injury ahead of tomorrow’s Premier League clash against West Brom.

Fulham have signed midfielder Giorgos Karagounis until the end of this season.

Greece star Giorgos Karagounis has demanded UEFA rescind a yellow card for diving that has ruined his Euro 2012 dream; having also been denied a place in the final itself eight years ago.

Russia fitness coach Raymond Verheijen believes his side deserved to bow out of Euro 2012 after the surprise 1-0 defeat by Greece in the final Group A clash on Saturday ended their involvement.

Greece opened their 2004 triumph with victory over hosts Portugal, and they will once again be looking to spoil the party, taking on the hosts in Warsaw tonight.

Poland captain Jakub Blaszczykowski issued a rallying cry ahead of tonight’s Euro 2012 opener against Greece, calling on his team mates to stand up and be counted in front of a 60,000 home crowd.

Giourkas Seitaridis and Christos Patsatzoglou have proved their fitness to gain inclusion in Greece’s 23-man World Cup squad.

PANATHINAIKOS gave themselves an excellent chance of qualifying for the Champions League quarter-finals by scoring a vital away goal against Villarreal last night.

DANI GUIZA headed home a late winner as a second-string Spain side battled back from a goal down in Salzburg to leave deposed champions Greece without a point in Euro 2008.

SWEDEN striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic is desperate to play against European Championship holders Greece despite a lack of match-fitness following a knee injury.

Liverpool suffered a double defensive injury blow prior to their Champions League last-16 second leg clash with Benfica at Anfield.

GROUP ONE: The Netherlands stayed on course for World Cup qualification with a 2-0 defeat of Armenia.

Greece coach Otto Rehhagel revealed he is a big fan of Czech Republic counterpart Karel Bruckner as his side prepares to tackle the new tournament favourites in tonight’s semi-final at the Estadio do Dragao.

Greece striker Demis Nikolaidis believes the Euro 2004 surprise packages will seize their “once-in-a-lifetime” opportunity and claim a place in the final by beating the Czech Republic tomorrow.
